From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • consejar (obsolete)

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Spanish consejar, from Latin consiliārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /akonseˈxaɾ/ [a.kõn.seˈxaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧con‧se‧jar

Verb

[edit]

aconsejar (first-person singular present aconsejo, first-person singular preterite aconsejé, past participle aconsejado)

  1. (transitive) to advise
    Synonym: dar consejos

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
